results.title: Furniture Craftsman
results.creator_credit: Edwin James Hipkiss and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: The work of designers and craftsmen in manufacturing “custom built” furniture. Pattern-making, laying out, band-sawing, power planing, joining, lathe turning, grooving, glueing, carving and finishing, as well as the relation between hand-tool operations and machine-tool operations are dealt with in detail.

results.title: Furnishing is fun
results.brief_description: How an average family in 1961, whose children have grown up, refurnishes the home. Shows the range of furnishings available in Australia, the advisory services, especially colour consultants and gives some indication of costs involved. Narrated by Gordon Bell and scripted by Burton Graham.

results.title: Furnace practice
results.creator_credit: CWS Film Unit and George Wynn
results.brief_description: A fuel economy film, for furnace men and plant managers, dealing with furnaces of all kinds - using coal, pitch, gas, oil or electricity. The ain is to get the heat and transmit it with the minimum loss. The chief subjects touched are firing methods, use of mechanical stokers; proper control of air supply; importance of cleanliness; repairs, maintenance, and improvements; recovery of hear from chimneys; need for careful records as a check on running economy.

results.title: Furnace control
results.creator_credit: Frank A. Hoare, John Durst and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Open hearth furnace series”.
Shows how temperature, pressure, gas and air flow are recorded and regulated by instruments to assist the melter in controlling the furnace.

results.title: Funny things happen down under
results.creator_credit: Roger Mirams, Pacific Films and Joe McCormick
results.brief_description: When the clubhouse of a group of country kids, known as the “Terrible ten” needs money for funding they invent numerous ways to make money. During their attempts at making puddings and selling mineral water they stumble on a formula for breeding coloured sheep.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Roger Mirams, Pacific Films and Joe McCormick

results.title: Funny by George
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Kewley, Onkus Pictures and Don Percy
results.brief_description: A documentary about the life of one of Australia’s most famous and influential comedians. Wallace was a creative force as a writer of his own material for vaudeville sketches and feature films and as a painter, musician, dancer and composer. From his early beginnings in country travelling shows and vaudeville, he became Australia’s first genuine box office star of the sound era appearing in five feature films and achieving international success. Using rare photographs, home movies, feature film footage and contemporary interviews, the filmmakers explore his personal and professional life and examine his lasting influence, thus restoring Wallace to his rightful place as a key figure in Australian entertainment history. Narrated by Bill Kerr.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jeremy Kewley, Onkus Pictures and Don Percy

results.title: Funny business
results.creator_credit: Sarah Williams, Tiger Television and David Hinton
results.brief_description: Rowan Atkinson knows his rubber face and gangly limbs are his tools of trade. The exaggerated gestures, tortured twitch of an eyebrow or deadpan expression guaranteed the phenomenal success of “Not the Nine O’Clock News”, “Black Adder” and “Mr. Bean”. There is however an art to being funny, and as mime artist Kevin Bartholomew (dressed in a lime green skin-tight body suit) the amazing rubber-faced one shows us, along with fellow comedy masters including John Cleese and Peter Sellers, that there is comedy potential in every part of the human anatomy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Williams, Tiger Television and David Hinton

results.title: Fungus plants
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Emphasis is given to the various mushrooms whose growth and reproduction are illustrated by time-lapse photography and animation. Moulds and other fungi are also presented by these same techniques. Their economic importance is indicated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Fungi and man
results.brief_description: Shows how fungi can alter the physical and chemical structure of organic materials in the environment, including humans themselves, in ways both chemical and harmful. Provides clear photography of fungi physiology.
